intro: Epidendrum hombersleyi, commonly known as the Hombersley's epidendrum, is a species of orchid native to Central America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces clusters of fragrant, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks, exhibiting an epiphytic lifestyle. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and arranged in a rosette pattern. It prefers warm, humid environments with bright, indirect light for optimal growth.
